example.context:
the address (which should start with "fetch") is invalid, it is probably expecting an Ethereum address (beginning with "0x") and is most likely trying to send ERC20 FET. In this case, you need to use the token bridge to swap your ERC20 FET for native FET.

Warning

You should not send ERC20 FET to this wallet. If you do, you will lose your tokens. The Fetch wallet can only hold native FET tokens and not ERC20 FET tokens.

Send Tokens¶

To send tokens from your account:

Select Send.

Fill in the details of your transaction:

Recipient: the address you want to send the tokens to
Token: the token denomination or type
Amount: the number of tokens you want to send with this transaction (you can see your current balance above the Amount)
Memo (Optional): some transactions (e.g. to/from some exchanges) require a specific memo. If not needed, you can leave it blank.
Fee: the transaction fee. Choose from Low, Average and High

Tip

Usually, the lower the transaction fee, the longer you need to wait for your transaction to be settled on the network.

Press Send.

In the summary screen, review the details and if everything is correct, select Approve.

Tip

You can check the status of your transaction via the explorer.

interactions.response: An Ethereum address is a public address used to send and receive Ethereum and other Ethereum-based tokens. It is composed of 40 characters and usually starts with the “0x” prefix.
ERC20 FET is a type of Ethereum-based token which follows the ERC20 token standard. It is used to represent ownership of the native FET token.
A token bridge is a system that allows users to swap ERC20 tokens for the native token on a specific blockchain. In the case of Fetch.ai, this is used to swap ERC20 FET for native FET.

responses: An Ethereum address is a unique identifier that is used to receive and send ETH or other tokens. It is a string of 40 hexadecimal characters that begin with the number “0x” and are used to identify individual accounts on the Ethereum blockchain.

ERC20 FET (Fetch.ai Token) is a utility token and the key medium of exchange on the Fetch.ai network. It is built on an Ethereum contract and can be used to pay for services in the Fetch ecosystem and network transaction fees.

A token bridge is a protocol that allows users to transfer tokens between different blockchain networks. Celer cBridge is an example of a token bridge that enables users to move ERC20 tokens, such as FET, between networks such as Ethereum and Ape Chain.
